juzs.text: (The man) said, "Did I not tell you? Indeed, you would be unable to bear me with patience
(Musa) said, "Don´t let me accompany you if I ask anything after this! There, you now have a reason (to part company)

The two men resumed (their journey), reached a town and requested food. The townfolks refused to put them up as guests. In the town, the man found a wall about ready to crumble. (The man) repaired it. (Musa) said, "Of course, if you wanted, you could have charged them for it
(The Man) said, "This is where we bid farewell to each other! I will give you the explanation of the things you could not endure
As for the ship, it belongs to some poor folks who operate it in the sea. I sought to make it defective; a king nearby, seizes all the (defect-free) ships forcibly
As for the boy, his parents are true believers. We feared that he would (grow up to) disobey them, oppress them and make them suffer tremendously
We wished that their Lord would grant them in exchange a just, honest and a more merciful (offspring)

And buried under the wall is a treasure. It belongs to two orphan brothers in town. Their father was pious! Your Lord decreed that (the boys) should discover (the treasure) when they attain the age of maturity. A mercy from your Lord. I did nothing of my own accord. That, in fact, was the reality which you witnessed but could not endure
They inquire about Dhul Qurnain. Say, "Here, I will tell you about him
We established him firmly in the land and laid at his disposal the means to obtain everything
He undertook a mission

And reached the land of the setting sun. He saw the sun setting behind the murky hot springs. And he found a people living there nearby. We said, "Oh Dhul Qurnain! You may punish them, or treat them nicely
He said, "We will punish the evil doer ourselves. Later, he returns to his Lord, Who will punish him with a woeful torture
(Dhul Qurnain said), "But the best of reward _ (paradise) _ is for the one who believes and acts righteously. We will treat him with kindness
Then he undertook another mission (eastward)
(And pressed on) till he reached the land of the rising sun. He found the sun rising upon a (primitive) people. We had not arranged any shelter for them against the sun
Such (was their state); and We knew exactly what he (Dhul Qurnain) possessed
Then he went on yet another mission
Until he reached a mountainous area and found in the valley a people who understood almost nothing
They said, "These Yajog and Majog run amock in the land. May we pay you a tax to have a barrier erected between them and us
Said, "(Thanks, but) the power my Lord has granted is enough (and far better)! Just help me with your manpower. I shall build a wall between them and you

Bring me blocks of steel." He blocked up the valley between the mountains (with a wall of steel) and said. "Now start a fire and blow (air through your bellows) till the wall becomes red hot." Then he said, "Bring me the molten copper to pour over the (iron) wall
The barbarians could neither scale (the wall) nor breach it
Said, "This is my Lord´s mercy upon you! (However) when the time comes for (the fulfillment of) my Lord´s promise, He will demolish it! My Lord´s promise is absolutely true
That day We will leave them rolling over each other (like waves), and then the trumpet will sound and We will gather them all together
And We shall display and bring within sight hell for the unbelievers
Those, whose eyes are sheathed (and insulated) against My reminder (the Qur´an) cannot stand even to listen to it
Did the unbelievers suppose that they can take _ instead of Me _ My slaves as their masters and get away with it? Indeed! To do them the honors, We have prepared hell
Say, "May we tell you about the worst of the losers
They are those who (in reality) squander away their efforts in the life of this world, yet regard their deeds to be good
Such are the ones who reject the signs of their Lord and the (forthcoming) meeting with Him. So their efforts amount to nothing. On the Day of Judgment, We shall assign them no weight at all
They shall have their reward _ hell. Because they disbelieved, and mocked My signs and My messengers
On the other hand, those who believe and do good deeds shall be honored with (the gift of) the gardens of paradise
There they shall live forever. They shall never desire to depart
Say, "Had the ocean served as ink to write about Allah, then surely the ocean would run out, but the narrative about Allah would not. Even if We supplied that much more ink as a refill

Say, "Surely, I am just a man like you. Revelation has been sent to me that your God is only one God! Hence, those hoping to meet their Lord should seek the righteous acts, and should not accept any partners in the worship of their Lord
Kaaf, Ya, Ain, Saad
This is the account of the blessings of your Lord upon Zakaria, His servant
When once he addressed his Lord in a soft voice
Said, "Lord! My bones have weakened and my head has lit up with the gray hair (of old age). I haven´t so far been denied anything I ever prayed to You for
I am concerned for my followers after my death. My wife is barren. But, please Lord! Grant me by Your grace a successor (son)
One who may inherit from me and from the family of Yaqub, and Lord, please let him be amongst those with whom You are well-pleased
Oh Zakaria, We give you the good news of a son. His name shall be Yahya! Never before have We created anyone with his kind of qualities
Said, "Lord! How could I have a son now? My wife is barren and I have attained a ripe old age
Said, "That shall be!" Your Lord said, "This is really easy for Me! I also gave you existence earlier when you were nothing
Said, "Lord! Assign a sign for me." Said, "Despite being healthy, you shall be unable to speak for three days. That shall be your sign
He emerged from the chamber, and gestured to his followers asking them to sing the praises (of Allah), morning and evening
Oh Yahya! Hold on to the book with all your might!" We gave him the wisdom even as a lad
And by Our grace, We granted him compassion and purity; he was pious
He was devoted and kind to his parents; not defiant or arrogant
Peace be upon him, the day he was born! The day he died! And the day he shall be brought back to life
And mention Mary in your narration. Once she excused herself from her family and retired to the eastern wing of the house
She drew the curtain behind her and there, We sent Our spirit (angel) to her! It appeared before her in the figure of a full grown man
She cried out, "I seek the protection of Rehman (the Merciful) from you, if you are a God-fearing person
He said, "What I am, is a messenger of your Lord to bestow upon you a pious son
Said, "How might I have a son? No man has ever touched me, nor am I a woman of loose morals
Said "It shall be! Your Lord says ´It is really too easy for Me´! It is preordained and shall come to pass, so as to make him a sign for the humankind and a blessing from Us´
She conceived and moved to a place far away
The distress of labor brought her under a date-palm tree. She said to herself, "I wish I was dead, long gone and forgotten before this ever happened
He (the angel) called her from close by, "Do not feel sorry for yourself. Your Lord has issued forth a spring right close to where you are
Shake the trunk of the date tree. Moist ripe dates will break loose and fall down
Eat, drink and stay calm. Should any one happen to pass by, tell him you are observing a fast for the sake of Rehman, (the Merciful), and hence shall not talk to anyone
She returned to her folks carrying him (the baby). They said, "Oh Mary! What an unprecedented act have you committed
Oh sister of Haroon! Your father was not wicked! Nor was your mother a loose woman
She pointed towards the infant. They said, "How can we converse with an infant lying in a crib
The infant said, "I am the servant of Allah! He appointed me His messenger, and granted me the gospel
He blessed me wherever I might happen to be, and has ordered me to enjoin the ´salat´ and the ´zakat´ as long as I am alive
(I am) devoted to my mother, not hapless and arrogant
Peace upon me the day I was born. The day I shall die. And the day I shall be brought back to life
Such was Jesus, the son of Mary! This is the real truth about him, which they dispute
It is not befitting of Allah to have a son. Exalted is He! Having decided the matter, He merely tells it, "Be!" Hence it becomes
Indeed, Allah is my Lord as well as your Lord! So worship Him. That is the straight path
Groups have disputed amongst themselves regarding the day (of judgment). Witnessing that great day shall be disastrous for those who deny its coming
On the day they shall come to Us, their vision and hearing shall be sharper! Today the evil-doers are clearly lost in their misguidance
Warn them of the regretful embarrassment of the day when the matter shall be decided and put to rest! Today they are in heedless and neglectful denial, and they do not believe
We shall inherit the earth, including all that is upon it. Towards Us they all shall return
And mention Ibraheem in the book; he was a truthful person and a prophet
He said to his father, "Oh Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees, nor hears, nor can protect you from anything
Oh Father, true knowledge did not come to you, but has come to me. So follow me, I shall lead you along the balanced path
Oh Father, do not obey Shaitan. Indeed, Shaitan is disobedient to Rehman
I am worried, Oh Father, that a great torment might fall upon you from Rehman, and that you might end up as a comrade of Shaitan
He said, "Have you turned away from your gods, oh Ibraheem? Desist, for if you do not, I shall stone you to death. Out of my sight, now
Said, "Peace be upon you. I shall ask my Lord to forgive you. He is really very kind to me
I hereby wash my hands of you, and those you call gods besides Allah. I will worship my Lord! I am confident, If I pray to Him, I shall not be deprived
After he abandoned them along with those whom they called gods beside Allah, We gave him Ishaq and Yaqub. We appointed each of them a prophet
We showered Our blessings upon them and gave them high honor
And mention Musa in the book. He was really chosen, a prophet and a messenger
We called him out from the right side of the mountain Toor, and pulled him close, so as to grant him a private audience
And We gave his brother, Haroon, to him as a prophet, a blessing from Us
And mention Ismail in the book. Indeed, he was true to his words, a prophet and a messenger
He obligated ´salat´ and ´zakat´ upon his family. In the eyes of his Lord, he was an adorable person
And in the book, mention Idrees. Indeed, he was a truthful person and a prophet
We raised him to an exalted status

These are the ones Allah showered His blessings upon. These prophets were the descendants of Adam, and the descendants of those We boarded on the boat with Nooh. They were the descendants of Ibraheem and Ismail. Those were the ones We picked for Our guidance! Such were they that when Our verses were recited to them, they fell prostrate on the ground, tears welling up in their eyes
They were succeeded by ignorant ones, those who squandered their "salat´ and followed their whims and the pleasures of the flesh. Their just deserts shall soon catch up with them
Except those who repent, believe, and perform good deeds. They will enter paradise. They will not be dealt with unfairly
Rehman has promised this paradise to His servants for eternity, in exchange for their belief in the unseen. Surely His promise will be fulfilled
In it, they shall hear nothing vulgar; only peace! There, each day and each night, their due portion (sustenance) shall be delivered to them
Such is the paradise, which We will allow only Our pious servants to inherit
(Angels said), "We descend only when ordered by your Lord. To Him belongs all that lies before us, behind us, and in between. Your Lord is not the One to forget
He is the sustainer of the heavens and the earth, and all else in between. So worship Him in steadfast obedience. Do you know any other comparable to Him
(Yet), man says "When I am dead, will I emerge back to life again
Does man not recall? It was We Who created him earlier, when he was nothing
By your Lord! Very definitely! We shall gather them and the Shaitans together. Then, certainly, We shall collect them all around the hellfire, in a manner that they shall be crawling on their knees
Thereafter, We shall definitely bring forth from each group of people the one who had been the most ardent and rebellious opponent of Rehman
Of course, We know very well who amongst them deserves to burn in hell
There isn´t any of you who can avoid passing by the hellfire. Your Lord has made this incumbent upon Himself
Then, We will let the transgressors fall tumbling down into it, but We will rescue those who have been heedful and pious

When Our clear lucid verses are recited, those who disbelieve the verses taunt those who believe by saying, "Which of the two of us has a better abode, and enjoys and mingles with better and more distinguished company
Many groups have We destroyed prior to them. They were better equipped, better furnished and better in appearance

Say, "Rehman gives leeway to those who indulge in gross negligence until they get to see that which is promised to be their lot, either the punishment (in this world) or the hour (of judgment)! They would soon realise whose status is lower! Whose allies are weaker
Allah increases in guidance those who are on the straight path, and the results of their good deeds are better with Allah in terms of rewards and consequences
Did you see the one who has chosen to deny Our signs and yet says, "I shall definitely be granted wealth and children
Has he peeked into the unseen? or has he entered into a contract with Rehman
Indeed not! Rather, We are recording everything he says. We shall extend his punishment a great deal further
We shall repossess all that he owns. And We shall bring him out all alone
They have taken gods other than Allah, so that they may have supporters
No! Indeed, their false gods will disown their worship, and they will become adversaries
Do you not notice? We send the Shaitans upon the disbelievers, and they continually incite and instigate them
Do not be impatient with them. We are counting down their days
That day, We will gather the pious (God-fearing) as guests of Rehman
While the sinners will be like thirst-stricken animals, whom We will shove towards the hellfire
No one has the ability to intervene, except those whom Rehman has promised
What? Do they say Rehman (God) has a son
They have surely brought forth a grave thing
So grave, indeed, that it may cause the earth to explode into pieces! Or the mountains may come tumbling down! Or the heavens might just crack asunder
They have dared to assign a son for Rehman
It is not befitting for Rehman to have a son
Every being in the heavens and on the earth shall come before Rehman as a slave
He is aware of their exact number, and He has counted them all up
On the Day of Judgment, each of them shall arrive all alone, and shall be on his own
And of course, Rehman will instill with love, the hearts of those who believe and do the righteous deeds
We have made this (Quran) easy for you, in your own language, in order that you may give the glad tidings to the pious and the God-fearing. With it, you may warn those that are belligerent
Many a people have We destroyed before them. So now, can you sense even a faint sign of their existence, or hear even a wisp of their tale
Ta, Ha
We have revealed to you this Qur´an, not to cause you distress
Rather, it is a memorandum _ (an advisory) _ for the one who fears
A communiqué from the Creator of the earth and the celestial heavens
Rehman, (the most magnificent), mounted the throne (and governs the universe majestically)
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on the earth, whatever lies between them, and whatever exists under (the surface of the earth)
You call Him out loud. (But remember), He knows even the most intimate thoughts _ thoughts that remain hidden (and unexpressed) forever
He is Allah! There is no god but He; His are all the beautiful names
Is the story of Musa known to you
When he spotted a campfire, he said to his family, "I notice a fire! Perhaps, I can bring a live coal from there (to start our own fire), or obtain directions (for the road ahead)
When he approached (the site of) the campfire, We called out to him, "Oh Musa
It is I, your Lord! Take your shoes off! You happen to be in the holy valley of Toah
I chose you! So listen to what is being revealed
Indeed, I am the One _ Allah! There is no god except Me! So obey Me and establish the ´salat´ (prayers) to remember Me
In fact, the hour (of Judgment) is sure to arrive! I want to keep (its time) undisclosed, so that every soul may be rewarded in accordance with its efforts
Hence, Do not ever let an unbeliever _ the one following his own whims _ dissuade you from it (the belief in the afterlife), lest you perish
And what is that (you hold) in your right (hand), oh Musa
Said, "It is my stick. I lean on it to rest my weight, and with it I chop off the leaves to feed my cattle. It also has other uses for me
Said, "Throw it down, Oh Musa
So he threw it down, and all of a sudden, it became a snake creeping around (swiftly)
(Allah) said, "Grab it, and do not be afraid. We will change it back to its earlier state
And place your hand in your armpit. (As you pull your hand out) it will appear dazzling white without any discomfort. Another sign
To show you (but just two of) Our great signs
Go to the pharaoh! He has exceeded (every) limit
(Musa) said, "Lord, unlock my heart
And make my task easy for me
And correct my speech impediment
(So) they understand my words
And appoint one of my family members (as an aide) to help me
My brother, Haroon
With him, bolster my strength
And make him a partner in my mission
So, we may glorify You a lot
And talk about You a lot
And certainly, You are watching over us
Said, "You are being granted your requests, oh Musa
We, in fact, conferred favors upon you at other times, too
When We inspired your mother by implanting an idea in her mind

(Saying) "Put (the child) in a box and push (the box) down the river. It will hurl (the box) ashore, where Our enemy _ his and Mine _ will pick him up." I bestowed love upon you, so you may be raised under My watchful eye

(Remember) when your sister walked (along the box) and said to those who found the child, "Shall I guide you to a wet nurse for him?" Thus We sent you back to your mother, to soothe her and to keep her from grieving. Then you killed a man. We rescued you from that distress. We had you go through a terrible ordeal. You lived with the people of Madyan a number of years. And now, you have arrived here at just the right (preordained) time
Oh Musa, I have selected you specifically for My sake
So proceed with My signs, both of you _ you and your brother. Do not become lax in remembering Me
Go to the pharaoh! Indeed, he has transgressed
But speak to him in an affable manner. Maybe he will heed, and fear (Allah)
They said, "Our Lord! We are afraid that he will let loose his rage upon us and will oppress us
Said, "Have no fear! I am with you, watching over and listening

So go to him and say, "We are the messengers of your Lord! Therefore, let the Israelites go with us and do not torture them. We have already brought you the proof from your Lord! Peace is upon him, who follows the guidance
Indeed, it has been revealed to us that punishment awaits the one who denies and turns away
(The pharaoh) asked, "So then, who is your Lord, oh Musa
Said, "The One Who gave each (existing) thing its nature and form, then guided it along
(The pharaoh) asked, "Then, what about the generations of yester years
Musa said, "The facts about them are known to my Lord and recorded in a book. He neither errs nor forgets
The same One Who made the earth your (safe) haven, carved roads in it for you, and sent water down from the sky." With that (water), We bring out vegetation of many diverse kinds
Eat! And feed your cattle, too. Indeed, in it is a sign for those who (accept) reason
We created you from this (very) earth. Into it We shall have you return, and from it We shall bring you out a second time
Surely, We had him look at all Our signs, but he rejected (them all) and refused (to believe)
(The pharaoh) said, "Are you here to drive us out of our land with your magic, oh Musa

And added, "Of course, we can perform that kind of magic too. So, go ahead! For our encounter pick a time and place _ a neutral location (accessible to all). We will not fail to show up. Nor should you
(Musa) said, "Let the coming festival day be the appointed date, and let the people gather at high noon
So, the pharaoh withdrew and with craftiness, put together a scheme, and then he arrived
Musa said to them. "Woe unto you! Do not make up lies against Allah. He will annihilate you (all) with a torment. Whoever invents lies against Allah fails
At that point, they began to dispute among themselves and held secret talks
At length they said, "These two are just magicians trying to evict you from your land by their spells. They want to deprive you of your exemplary way of life
So rally all your tricks, then act in unison. Whoever triumphs today will prosper
They said, "Oh Musa, either you cast (your spell) first, or else let us be the first to cast (the spell)
(Musa) said, "No! You go first. Then suddenly, because of their spell, it appeared to him that their ropes and sticks (were snakes and) were creeping about swiftly
A sense of fear came over Musa
We said, "Do not be afraid. You will be the one to triumph, for sure

Throw down the stick in your right hand. It will gobble up the spell they have cast. What they have conjured up is only a trick of the magicians, and magicians never succeed when they come (to face the truth)
The magicians lost out, threw themselves down on the ground prostrate, and said, "We accept the Lord of Haroon and Musa

The pharaoh said, "You believed him, even though I did not permit you? Obviously, he is your master who has taught you the magic! Now, I will definitely chop off your hands and feet on opposite sides and then crucify you on the trunk of the date-palm tree. You will soon know which one of us awards the severer and the more lasting punishment

They said, "In the face of the clear signs that have come to us, we will not prefer you to the One Who has created us. So do whatever you decree. Surely, you exercise control (only) in the life of this world
We have really believed in our Lord! So He may forgive our sins, as well as the magic you compelled us to perform. Allah is better, and the Immortal
Indeed, hell is for the one who comes to his Lord as a criminal. There, he will never die _ nor live
The exalted ranks are for those who come to their Lord as believers, having done righteous deeds
(As also) the elevated gardens, through which run the rivers. There, they shall live forever! This is the reward for those who endeavor to purify themselves
Indeed, We revealed to Musa, "Go and take My servants with you. Strike a dry path through the sea. Do not be frightened of being overtaken (by the Pharaoh in hot pursuit), nor be afraid (of the sea)
The pharaoh pursued them with his army. They were drowned by that which engulfed them from all sides
The pharaoh led his nation astray _ did not guide well
Oh Children of Israel! We rescued you from your enemy, granted you an audience by the right side of the mountain ´Toor´, and sent down the ´munna´ and the ´salwa´ for you
Eat the wholesome food We have provided, but do not be overly excessive. Else, My wrath will come down upon you. Surely, the one upon whom lands My fury, comes tumbling down
Yet, undoubtedly, I am the One Who grants forgiveness to anyone who repents, believes and acts righteously; and then stays steadfast (till death)
(Allah asked), "What made you come (to Me) ahead of your people, oh Musa
Said, "They´re coming right behind. I hurried towards You, Lord, so You may be pleased
(Allah) said, "After you left, We subjected your people to a test. Saamari led them astray

So Musa returned to his nation, angry and aggrieved, and said, "Oh my people, did your Lord not make you excellent promises? Has it been too long for you? Or do you just want the fury of your Lord to land on you? Is that why you broke your pledge with me

They said, "We did not willfully opt to break our promise to you. In fact, the burden of carrying people´s jewelry had worn us down. So we unloaded it (into the fire). Likewise, Saamari threw it down, too
Then, he shaped the gold into the figure of a calf, and it mooed like one! People cried out, "This is your God. The God of Musa. He forgot (to mention it)
Did they not see that it did not respond to them at all? Nor did it have the ability to hurt them, or help them
Even though Haroon had told them earlier, "Oh my people! You are being tested with it (the calf). Really, your Lord is the most Merciful. So follow me, all of you! And obey my command
They said, "We will not quit worshipping (the calf) until Musa comes back
Musa (when he returned) said, "Oh Haroon, when you saw them going astray, what held you back
Why did you not follow me? Did you disobey my instructions
Haroon said, "Oh son of my mother! Do not tug at my beard, nor pull my hair! I was afraid you would blame me and say ´You caused a split among the Israelites, and did not follow my instruction.´
Said, "And what about you, Oh Saamari
(Saamari) said, "I realized what others failed to. So I collected a handful (of dust) from the footmarks of the prophets and tossed it on the calf. That is what my self prompted me to do

(Musa) said, "Go! This is (the punishment) for you: in this life you will (continually) utter ´Do not touch me´, and you have an appointment (in the afterlife) which you cannot skip. Now watch that god of yours, upon whose worship you insisted. We will surely melt it down, then scatter it around in the ocean
As a matter of fact, Allah (alone) is your God! Besides Him there is no other god, and His knowledge extends over all things
Thus, We narrate to you the tales of what went on earlier. We have granted you this (book of) advisement from Ourselves
Indeed, those ignoring it shall bear a burdensome punishment on the Day of Judgment
They shall forever remain in it _ (that condition of torment). Baneful shall be their burden on the Day of Judgment
The day the trumpet sounds will be the day We will gather the criminals, their eyes agape with fright
Among themselves they will whisper, "You stayed (on the earth) only ten days
Of course We know very well what they shall say. The most accurate among them will say, "You stayed there for just a day
They are asking you about the mountains. Tell them, "My Lord will blow them up into fine dust
He will turn (this earth) into a plain wasteland
You will not find any ridges or cracks on it

On that day, they will (meekly) respond to the convener _ (the angel) _ who shall face no hindrance. In the presence of Rehman, voices will drop to a subdued hush. You shall hear nothing but faint whispers
That day, mediation shall benefit no one, unless Rehman grants permission, and about whom He pleases to hear (favorable) remarks
He knows all that lies ahead of them as well as everything about their past. Others do not know at all
All heads will bow before the Eternally Alive and the Ever-lasting. Anyone carrying a burden of having committed an injustice shall fail miserably
(Whereas) those who had acted righteously _ provided they had believed _ shall have no fear of being wronged or short changed
Thus, We revealed this Qur´an in Arabic. In it We have defined sharply the promises and the threats. Maybe they will fear (Allah), or it _ (the Qur´an) _ will bring back the remembrance (of Allah)
Allah, the Genuine Emperor, is the most Exalted! Do not be in a hurry to repeat (the fresh verses of) the Qur´an before the revelations conclude. Say, "Lord, enhance me in knowledge
Earlier, We had entrusted Adam with a task, but his memory lapsed. We did not find in him the firmness of resolve
(Remember)! We said to the angels, "Fall down prostrate before Adam!" And they all fell prostrate, except Iblees (Shaitan). He refused
So We said, "Oh Adam, that one, surely, is your and your wife´s enemy. Now do not let him drive you out of paradise, lest you feel distressed
Of course, here (in paradise), it is your (privilege) that you do not go hungry, nor are you unclad
And here you are not thirsty, troubled by the (sultry sweltering) sun
Yet Shaitan whispered (and aroused) doubts in his mind saying, "Oh Adam, shall I show you the tree of immortality, and the domain that has no demise

Both of them _ (Adam and his wife) _ ate its fruit and their genitalia became visible to them. With the leaves of the Garden of Eden they began to cover themselves. Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray
Later, his Lord favored him, granted him forgiveness and guided him

(Allah) said, "Get down from here! Both of you _ (Adam and Shaitan)! You are each other´s enemy. Whoever follows the guidance _ when the guidance from Me arrives _ will not go astray, and will not be miserable
While a wretched (unwholesome) livelihood will be the lot of the one who turns away from My advice and warning. He will be blind when We round him up on the Day of Judgment
He shall say, "Lord, why did You raise me blind? I used to be endowed with eyesight
Allah will say, "Much the same as you ignored My signs when they came to you! Befittingly, today you are being ignored
This is how We chastise the one who exceeds the bounds, and ignores the signs of his Lord. The punishment of the afterlife is far worse and ever persisting
Many towns have We destroyed before them. Did that fact not teach them? They walk through those ruins! There are surely signs in it for those with intellect
The word of your Lord has been proclaimed! Had it not been, and if it wasn´t essential and for a specific period, (then their doom and demise would be instant)

Therefore, with patience bear their remarks and chant the praises of your Lord before the sun rises, before it sets, and during the night. Glorify Him in the morning and evening. Perhaps you will feel contented

Do not look (enviously) at the splendors of this life with which We have furnished some of their groups. It is (merely) to test them. The grants of your Lord (in the afterlife) are far better and ever lasting
Bid your family to observe the ´salat´, and stay steadfast upon it yourself. We do not seek sustenance from you. Indeed, We bestow sustenance. The final outcome hinges on piety
They say, "Why did he not bring us a sign?" Did clear proofs _ those narrated in the earlier scriptures _ not reach them

Had We, prior to sending him (Muhammad, SAW), ruined them with a disaster, they would have complained, "Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your signs instead of being disgraced and humiliated
Say, "Each (soul) is in a state of waiting. You wait, too! Soon you will find out who is on the right path, and well-guided
